channel.title: Variable from one page to another - PHP
channel.description:
So, I got somethin' like this:
<?php $someVar = ....; include ('some.page.php'); ?>
And I want 'some.page.php' to receive the variable.
Any chances on that?

item.title: Variable from one page to another - PHP
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:16, topic:190273”]I have a container with two left floating divs.

These divs stick out of the container.
I want to prevent that.[/quote]

margin: 0;
padding: 0;

Read full topic

item.title: Variable from one page to another - PHP
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

Yeah, when you load one file (traditional include, require) (file2) into another (file1), file2 inherits all the variables (and their values), functions, and classes of file1. Nothing should be necessary.

Read full topic

item.title: Variable from one page to another - PHP
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:1, topic:190273”]So, I got somethin’ like this:

<?php $someVar = ....; include ('some.page.php'); ?>

And I want ‘some.page.php’ to receive the variable.

Any chances on that?[/quote]

In an instance like this, some.page.php should automatically receive the contents of $someVar and is capable of calling it. I don’t understand what you mean?

Read full topic
item.source: Variable from one page to another - PHP

item.title: Variable from one page to another - PHP
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

if you haven’t found a fix yet, you could try using constants:
[php]<?php
define(“someConstant”, “value”, “false”); //constant name, value, case sensivity
?>[/php]

then, on the included page, do:
[php<?php echo someConstant; ?>[/php]

hope this helps

Read full topic

Maybe you can check out the “global” keyword?
http://www.phpit.net/article/using-globals-php/

item.description:

[quote=“nator123123, post:2, topic:190273”]I’d use require() instead btw.
have you even tested it? I can’t test it right now because I’m on my mac with like… no programs.[/quote]Been there, done that.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 17, 2008, 06:54:06 AM[/size][hr][quote=“kloplop321, post:3, topic:190273”]you could use $_SESSION[‘someVar’] = …; and then redirect[/quote]Session variables seem to work as much as using Get variables, which is not at all.
